messages.content:
You are my personal assistant. The first message that I will send you will contain a job description. You will use my resume and the job description to help me respond to the job application questions for the job in the job description:Earl Nathaniel Chase III
Brooklyn, NY | 713.517.1301 | echase3@gmail.com  


ANALYST
Adaptable Analyst with extensive experience in managing the post-trade life cycle and driving operational efficiency. Strong expertise in risk management, trading execution, and account reconciliation. Proficient in using Python for developing automation solutions to streamline processes and improve accuracy. Trusted by management for navigating complex regulatory environments and ensuring adherence to industry standards. 


AREAS OF EXPERTISE
Operations | Python | Regulatory Compliance |Trading | Capital Markets | Quantitative Analysis | Problem-Solving


PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

Milliman, Chicago, IL	July 2022 - March 2023
Milliman is an independent risk management, benefits, and technology firm with offices in major cities around the globe.
Analyst
Actively supported trade desk, portfolio management team, and actuaries in all aspects of the post-trade life cycle, including trade execution, risk management, and account reconciliation.

Designed and implemented a dashboard in MS Access using SQL of daily OTC trades across all client accounts in order to ensure accurate record-keeping. 
Created and maintained Python scripts used to send and receive trade data received from clients and brokers via FTP.
Utilized Python to create automated emails and responses for our clients’ daily options settlements and daily variation margin requirements, ensuring timely and accurate responses to all inquiries.
Collaborated with the trading team and technologists to ensure the prompt resolution of breaks. 

Wells Fargo Securities, Minneapolis, MN 	August 2020 - February 2022
Financial services company and leading middle-market banking provider in the United States.
Analyst
Provided operational support to the Treasury Cash Management group to ensure timely, accurate and compliant processing of wire transfers and ACH transactions used for trade settlements. 


Developed Excel VBA macros used to process and upload over 100 wire transactions for trade settlements, variation margin payments, interest payments and bond redemptions, totaling $1 Billion+ daily.
Used Nexen and Broadridge to reconcile cash balances of client accounts as well as accounts held by the cash management team.
Used VBA to create a simple dashboard that measured the wire volume and the productivity of the six desks managed by the team.
Collaborated with WFSE and WFSIL to ensure the proper segregation of foreign currency accounts and adherence to regulatory requirements.

L'Équipe de Recherche en Epidemiologie Nutritionnelle (EREN), Paris, France         October 2019 - March 2021
University of Paris research team in Nutritional Epidemiology.
Research Intern
Explored objectives, methods, results, and conclusions through scientific research, writing, and presentations.


Co-authored “Modelling the number of avoidable new cancer cases in France attributable to alcohol consumption by following public health recommendations”.  
Conducted a literature review on the relationship between cancer and the consumption of alcohol.
Aided in the creation of a model used to estimate the effects of price and other political constraints on alcohol and their subsequent effects on alcohol-related cancers.


Dominium, Plymouth, MN	May 2019 - August 2019
Dominium is one of the nation’s most innovative affordable housing development and management companies.
Intern
Assisted the analysts, associates, developers, and project partners with all aspects of the real estate development process. 


Conducted, interpreted, and presented market research during the project feasibility stage.
Identified prospective sites for multi-family developments.
Assisted in the completion of Federal Home Loan Bank loan applications.
Contributed to the creation of pro-forma and discounted cash flow models in Excel.


EDUCATION
Bachelor of Arts (BA)
Macalester College, Saint Paul, MN


TECHNICAL SKILLS
 Python | SQL |VBA | VBS | Advanced Excel | Bash | Git | Pandas | Numpy | Scipy | Pyspark

Job description: XTX Markets is a leading algorithmic trading company partnering with counterparties, exchanges and e-trading venues globally to provide liquidity in the Equity, FX, Fixed Income, Commodity & Options markets. We provide consistent liquidity, helping market participants throughout the world obtain the best prices in the various assets classes we cover, regardless of changing market conditions.

At XTX Markets technology is our business and we are a diverse organisation which attracts outstanding talent from across all industry backgrounds. We are focused on teamwork and our people collaborate on all aspects of the business, working openly and with respect for each other, our clients and the market. Our culture is non-hierarchical and one where everyone is valued. We strive for excellence in everything we do.

 

The Role


An operations role at XTX will provide exposure across all areas of the business. You will be given the opportunity to take ownership over processes early on. With the guidance of the team, candidates will improve and develop new processes using a range of technical skills such as Go and SQL. Resolving a broad set of daily issues will mean regularly interacting with other teams and external counterparties.

Our ethos is to develop robust, scalable solutions that improve the efficiency of the team and accuracy of our data. This is an opportunity to take part in the growth of a company where decisions make a difference. The impact of operations is far beyond what you usually see within large institutions.

XTX are looking for technically minded candidates with enthusiasm and initiative. The role is an opportunity to contribute to a small team with new ideas and make a real and positive impact to the team itself, as well as the firm.

The team has presence in London, Singapore, New York, and Paris. This role is for New York.

 

Responsibilities

Trade support, including daily reconciliations of cash, positions, and trading activity.
Liaising with counterparties and exchanges on daily issues.
Building and maintaining automated processes.
Working with the technology team to develop new tools and applications.
Managing cash/collateral across multiple brokers and clearing houses.
Production of various reports (including P&L, risk, treasury).
Live risk monitoring and escalation.
Regulatory reporting monitoring.
Onboarding new exchanges, counterparties, brokers, or products around the world as the business expands.
Opportunities to gain exposure to various assets classes across the entire trade life cycle.
Ad-hoc trade executions.
Ad-hoc data analysis and report generation.
 

Essential Attributes

Approximately 0-2 years of experience in a transferable role. We are happy to accept recent graduates for this role but you must be able to start immediately full-time in our New York office.
Bachelor’s or master’s degree with a minimum GPA of 3.5 in Mathematics, Engineering or Computer Science.
Keen to learn new technical skills (we troubleshoot and/or write code every day).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Diligent, focused and prepared to take ownership early on.
Programming experience (Python, Java, Go) related to automation.
Experience with Equities, Futures, FX and Options is advantageous.
A demonstrated aptitude and interest in process improvement.
